description: This file contains helper function declarations for managing context related to RBUS (RDK Bus) in a cellular management module. It provides functions for initializing, releasing, and manipulating row contexts, converting paths, and querying dynamic table synchronization status.

methods.name: Context_Init
methods.description: Initializes the RBUS context helper API, maintaining a reference count for safe repeated calls.

methods.name: Context_Release
methods.description: Releases the RBUS context helper resources, should be called once for every Context_Init.

methods.name: ConvertPath
methods.description: Converts a path containing row aliases to a path with only instance numbers.

methods.name: GetParentContext
methods.description: Retrieves the context for a parameter inside a row.

methods.name: GetRowContext
methods.description: Retrieves the context of a specific row.

methods.name: SetRowContext
methods.description: Sets the context for a new row along with its instance number and optional alias.

methods.name: RemoveRowContextByInstNum
methods.description: Removes the context for a row identified by its instance number.

methods.name: RemoveRowContextByName
methods.description: Removes the context for a row specified by its full name including alias and instance number.

methods.name: IsTimeToSyncDynamicTable
methods.description: Determines if it is appropriate to synchronize dynamic tables at this time to prevent multiple syncs during partial updates.

methods.name: GetParamName
methods.description: Extracts the leaf parameter name from a full path.

methods.name: GetHandlerContext
methods.description: Returns a handler context structure for a given element name.

ctags.name: fullName
ctags.pattern: /^    char const* fullName;   \/*full name of element with any table alias converted to instance n/

ctags.name: name
ctags.pattern: /^    char const* name;       \/*leaf name of element*\/$/

ctags.name: userData
ctags.pattern: /^    void* userData;         \/*any context data set for the this element's containing object (e./
